name: A Scandal in Bohemia
summary: Sherlock Holmes finds himself evenly matched when he is employed by the King of Bohemia to retrieve an indiscreet photograph from the American actress and singer, Irene Adler.

name: The Dancing Men
summary: A gentleman is baffled when the childish drawings of little dancing men terrify his American wife. Sherlock Holmes soon discovers why.

name: The Naval Treaty
summary: An unknown thief steals an important naval treaty from a Foreign Office clerk. Sherlock Holmes sets out to find it.

name: The Solitary Cyclist
summary: A strange man on a bicycle follows a young music teacher as she bicycles on a lonely road to and from the city.

name: The Crooked Man
summary: Colonel Barclay is found dead and his wife is arrested for the murder, but Holmes is convinced a missing door key will reveal the true killer.

name: The Speckled Band
summary: A young woman asks for Holmes' help when her ill-tempered stepfather moves her into the same room where her sister died under mysterious circumstances.

name: The Blue Carbuncle
summary: When the Countess of Morcar's priceless blue carbuncle is stolen, a reformed thief is charged with the crime.

name: The Copper Beeches
summary: Mr. Rucastle's odd requirements for governess Violet Hunter alarm her, so she seeks Holmes' advice.

name: The Greek Interpreter
summary: An unsavory gang kidnaps a Greek interpreter and forces him to relate their demands to an abductee who knows only the Greek tongue.

name: The Norwood Builder
summary: When a notorious retired builder is found dead, his recently-named heir is the prime suspect.

name: The Resident Patient
summary: A mysterious man sets up a new doctor in a posh practice for a percentage of the doctor's fees.

name: The Red-Headed League
summary: What seems at first to be a harmless prank played upon a red-headed man is soon revealed to be much more; a sinister scheme devised by the Napoleon of Crime.

name: The Final Problem
summary: Holmes and Watson travel to Europe to escape Moriarty's vengeance.

name: The Abbey Grange
summary: Holmes is called to a manor house to investigate the brutal murder of a country lord with a fireplace poker, and reconcile the story of his bruised and battered wife with the facts.

name: The Musgrave Ritual
summary: An obscure family document containing an enigmatic ritual holds the key to a hidden treasure if Holmes can decipher the mystery.

name: The Second Stain
summary: Holmes is asked by the country's Prime Minister to aid in the recovery of a stolen diplomatic letter, which, if published, might lead England into war.

name: The Man with the Twisted Lip
summary: Responding to a grieving wife, Holmes investigates the apparent murder of her husband in an apartment above an opium den.

name: The Priory School
summary: The headmaster of a prestigious prep school calls on Holmes for help when the ten year old only son of powerful duke disappears.

name: The Six Napoleons
summary: Inspector Lastrade reveals to Holmes that someone has been breaking into homes for the senseless purpose of destroying small busts of Napoleon.

name: The Sign of Four
summary: The disappearance of a young woman's father, and a mysterious note years later after the strange regular annual delivery of valuable pearls to her, puts Sherlock Holmes on the case.

name: The Devil's Foot
summary: While convalescing in Cornwall, a depressive Holmes investigates the apparent death from apoplexy of a local woman and the unexplained sudden dementia of her two brothers.

name: Silver Blaze
summary: Holmes investigates the disappearance of a champion racehorse and the murder of its trainer on a lonely moor.

name: Wisteria Lodge
summary: A bored Holmes eagerly accepts a case involving the disappearance of an amateur Spanish cartographer, as well as his servants, from his rented country lodge.

name: The Bruce Partington Plans.
summary: Sherlock's brother, Mycroft, enlists his younger sibling to locate missing patent plans that pertain to a strategically critical state-of-the-art submarine.

name: The Hound of the Baskervilles
summary: When the latest heir to the Baskerville estate seems to be threatened by a family curse, only the master detective, Sherlock Holmes, can find out the truth.

name: The Disappearance of Lady Frances Carfax
summary: Holmes must save a suffragette after Watson meets her and notices she is troubled by a mysterious bearded man.

name: The Problem of Thor Bridge
summary: A governess is arrested for the murder of her employer's wife.

name: Shoscombe Old Place
summary: The horse trainer of a debt-ridden aristocrat consults Holmes about his employer's behaviour.

name: The Boscombe Valley Mystery
summary: When William McCarthy is found dead, the son with whom he had just quarreled is charged with murder.

name: The Illustrious Client
summary: Sir James Damery asks Holmes to stop a general's daughter from marrying a philandering, but seductively attractive, murderer.

name: The Creeping Man
summary: Holmes thinks a woman's claim to have seen a man at her upstairs bedroom window is related to the theft of several apes.

name: The Master Blackmailer
summary: Holmes and Watson attempt to break the grip of a ruthless blackmailer on of their clients.

name: The Last Vampyre
summary: Sherlock Holmes is called upon to investigate a series of deaths which seem to be related to John Stockton, who is rumoured to be descended from a family of vampires.

name: The Eligible Bachelor
summary: Holmes suffers from disturbing dreams as he helps to find the missing wife of Lord Robert St. Simon.

name: The Three Gables
summary: After her grandson's death, an old woman consults Holmes, after refusing a strange offer to buy her house including all its contents.

name: The Dying Detective
summary: A man dies of a mysterious tropical disease on which his cousin, his heir, is the sole authority.

name: The Golden Pince-Nez
summary: Holmes and Mycroft investigate the murder of a professor's assistant who died clutching a woman's pince-nez.

name: The Red Circle
summary: Mrs. Hudson asks Holmes to help her friend with a lodger who insists on nobody entering his room, and his secret past is uncovered.

name: The Mazarin Stone
summary: Mycroft investigates when the Mazarin Stone is stolen from a museum, and Watson deals with the promise of a large inheritance if a third person with the surname of Garrideb can be found.

name: The Cardboard Box
summary: Susan Cushing asks Holmes' help in solving the disappearance of her sister Mary Browner, but it doesn't seem Holmes' type of case until he is told of a Christmas present's grisly contents.
